TestDescription.name: Rails application running in development mode
TestDescription.Description: This Ruby on Rails web application is running in development mode. When you generate a Ruby on Rails application it will create three environments: development, production and test. In development mode, Rails is not as secure as it shows diagnostics pages that leak a lot of sensitive information about the application internals.
TestDescription.Impact: Possible sensitive information disclosure. An attacker can use this information to conduct further attacks.
TestDescription.Recommendation: It's recommended to configure your Rails application to run in production mode. Usually, the following command will run your application in production mode. [pre] rails server -e production [/pre]

Reference.database: Use of Ruby on Rails environments
